metadata.Title: CVE-2021-33621 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The cgi gem before 0.1.0.2, 0.2.x before 0.2.2, and 0.3.x before 0.3.5 for Ruby allows HTTP response splitting. This is relevant to applications that use untrusted user input either to generate an HTTP response or to create a CGI::Cookie object.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33621` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby3.1 - 3.1.2-6
ruby3.1 - 3.1.2-6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jruby package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
ruby3.1 package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1.2-6').
